body: I think the "gift" she gave him, was something more of self fulfillment. With the ability to only love Yoruko, it gave him the ability to streamline his focus more into just doing what he wanted, he said he wanted to be a scholar, and with love being out of the picture he was able to focus more on his career.

@MyDickIsSolid you got your answer, she's basically just a playful spirit of a dead girl from all the stories we got so far

One more thing to add is that this is the first time in the Yoruko series, we see the clear image of what species the butterflies that occupied her. Black swallowtail, in many cultures it is often being said to brings omens of death and biblically its appearance indicates sudden ominous change in life. In the Yoruko series it acts as a spirit guide to her assumed the story she told in the Taxi Driver story (368327) is actually her backstory. End of analysis, have a good one.

This Yoruko doujin is very interesting especially the artist's choice of making the cover art a direct reference to the painting "The Kiss" by Gustav Klimt. In the original painting, it shows a male figure embracing a woman and kissed her, which many would think he's the dominant figure but in fact the woman's legs are exposed below showing that she was kneeling indicates that she was much more larger than her male companion and therefore would be the dominating one in this relationship, just like Yoruko and the male protagonist in the story. Secondly, in "The Kiss" the woman's spiral hair indicate erotic sensation and the man's hands wrap around her head evokes warmth and her closed eyes evoke ecstasy but also a mix of fear that this loving moment might disappear forever. The thing is that Yoruko's eyes do not closed in the cover art for her facial expressions evoke mischievous and selfish fulfillment indicates that the love in the story is just for mere sexual desire of herself.
Yoruko seemed genuinely into it, maybe she's what she hates most (or at least preys on most heh).
Hot but these 2 latest have been lacking in the action department. Please longer
